NAICS Translation: 32599: All Other Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Under a settlement announced by the United States, the State of Michigan and the Saginaw Chippewa Indian Tribe of Michigan, The Dow Chemical Company will implement and fund natural resource restoration projects intended to compensate the public for injuries to natural resources caused by the release of hazardous substances from Dow's Midland, Michigan facility.

Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, the Department of Justice and the Louisiana Department of Environmental Quality announced a settlement with Dow Chemical Company and two subsidiaries, Performance Materials NA Inc. and Union Carbide Corporation, that will eliminate thousands of tons of air pollution from four of Dow's petrochemical manufacturing facilities in Texas and Louisiana. Dow agreed to pay a civil penalty of $3 million with $2.325 million going to the U.S., and $675,000 going to Louisiana.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
